title: WTC Final, AUS vs IND Day 5 as it happened: Australia crowned champions after 209-run win
content:
India‚Äôs wait for an ICC trophy (men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs) continues for now. That will be all for the blog. Stay tuned for some post-match reactions. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Australia are officially crowned champions #WTCFinal pic.twitter.com/kGAIJaT5ZQ‚Äî 7Cricket (@7Cricket) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Player of the final: Travis Head 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Australia are champions: Some more reactions here
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Congratulations, Australia! üá¶üá∫A roaring victory in the ICC World Test Championship 2023 Final üéâ#WTC23 | #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/VE01bWheMQ‚Äî ICC (@ICC) June 11, 2023



    The big plus for India has been the batting of @ajinkyarahane88. Looked very classy, very stylish and I so hope it is the second wind to his test career‚Äî Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 11, 2023



    Great work to the Aussie side on winning the #WTC üèÜ Travis Head‚Ä¶well played & Smith doing what he does in England. Scoring runs for fun. Now to celebrate, then onto the #Ashes‚Äî Lisa Sthalekar (@sthalekar93) June 11, 2023



    That's a very big tick on Pat Cummins' English summer To Do list. Australia got themselves well in front of the game in the first two days and it was always going to be tough for India from there. It's been entertaining and great to see big crowds at the Oval. #WTCFinal‚Äî Melinda Farrell (@melindafarrell) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Australia are champions: Between Australian men and women‚Äôs cricket teams, the ICC trophy collection is complete.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Lyon ended up with 4/41. #JustSaying #WTCFinal2023‚Äî Ashish Magotra (@clutchplay) June 11, 2023



    That was brutal, emphatic stuff from Australia. By the end of the Smith/Head partnership on Day 1, India's WinViz was 15% - it never got back above that.  For the Aussies, it's the start of a legacy-defining summer. For India, it feels a little like the end of an era.‚Äî Ben Jones (@benjonescricket) June 11, 2023



    Australia add the only missing silverware to their trophy cabinet. What a comprehensive win! #WTC23‚Äî Prajakta (@18prajakta) June 11, 2023



    The better team in these conditions won. Well played Australia.‚Äî Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 11, 2023



    #WTC23 #WTCFinal #AUSvINDWTC FINAL, 2021: Runners-upWTC FINAL, 2023: Runners-upThe wait continues for Indiahttps://t.co/j4ugsq5Qq3 pic.twitter.com/xksfWEchHt‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    AUSTRALIA WIN BY 209 RUNS!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  63.3: Mohammed Siraj 1(6) ct Scott Boland b Nathan Lyon It‚Äôs all over for India. Australia are the World Test Champions! Nathan Lyon finishes with four wickets. India 234 all out
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 234/9 (63 overs): Shami with a few hits against Starc before the inevitable. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  61.5: Srikar Bharat 23(41) ct & b Nathan Lyon And India lose their last proper batter. Australia inches away from victory. A caught and bowled dismissal for Lyon, who now has three wickets in the match. India 224/9 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 224/8 (61 overs): Mohammed Shami is attempting a few hits before it all ends. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Two wickets needed for Australia. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    That grab was not as easy as Carey made it look.‚Äî Sa. Gomesh | ‡Æö. ‡Æï‡Øã‡ÆÆ‡Øá‡Æ∑‡Øç (@SaGomesh) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  60.2: Umesh Yadav 1(12) ct Alex Carey b Mitchell Starc Australia are just messing with India now. Starc bounces Umesh Yadav with a nasty short ball and it proves to be too much for him. India 220/8 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    It might not appear so but Indian cricket is in a bit of mess. Just check batting figures from 2021-23. Needs intent to clear this out & only a chairman of selectors with balls can get things done.Will we get one?! CoS has been vacant for six months now. Unimaginable, but true.‚Äî Chetan Narula (@chetannarula) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 218/7 (59 overs): Starc continues to steam in at 140+ kph. Five runs off the over due to overthrows. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Greater chance of session being extended by 30min so Australia can bowl out India... than there was of an Indian win before play started. #IndvsAus #WTCFinal2023‚Äî Chetan Narula (@chetannarula) June 11, 2023



    Shardul Thakur's first non half century at The Oval fwiw.‚Äî Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  57.4: Shardul Thakur 0(5) lbw Nathan Lyon Shardul Thakur has to depart without a fight. The umpire hands Lyon the lbw but Shardul reviews it. The ball-tracking shows it‚Äôs plumb. India 213/7
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    88 in 1st innings.46 in 2nd innings.One of the remarkable comeback stories in Indian cricket, playing a Test after 512 days, in the big final when most have failed, Rahane fought well for India. pic.twitter.com/VCGjZRq6TQ‚Äî Johns. (@CricCrazyJohns) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  56.2: Ajinkya Rahane 46(108) ct Alex Carey b Mitchell Starc And another set-batter departs before the fifty! Rahane, the top-scorer in the first innings, almost looked like he was on to something despite India‚Äôs bleak chances. Starc draws the edge as Rahane throws his hands at it. He‚Äôs livid with himself. India 212/6 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 212/5 (56 overs): Spin for the first time in the day! Rahane places on ethrough the cover point against Lyon. Six runs off the over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 206/5 (55 overs): Starc continues to steam in at 140+ kph. Rahane drives one straight past mid-off in the very first delivery. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 202/5 (54 overs): Just one run off the Green over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 201/5 (53 overs): A terrific off drive by Rahane for four in that Starc over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Back after the drinks break. The win is in Aussie sights.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 195/5 (52 overs): Bharat drives one past the square point for four. Five runs off the over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 190/5 (51 overs): Starc comes in from round the wicket. Three runs off the over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 187/5 (50 overs): Green comes back into the attack. 1 run off the over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 186/5 (49 overs): Boland surely has to be in the XI for that Ashes first Test you imagine.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    For the most part of this match India have been in a rage-against-the-dying-light kind of situation, but it‚Äôs just that the rage hasn‚Äôt been rage-y enough.‚Äî Tareque Laskar (@tarequelaskar) June 11, 2023



    SCREAMER! ü§©A massive moment in the game! ‚òùFollow the #WTC23 Final üëâ https://t.co/wJHUyVnX0r pic.twitter.com/GsHFfOGCme‚Äî ICC (@ICC) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 184/5 (48 overs): Cummins bangs one short and it hits Bharat‚Äôs helmet. The physios come to check on him. Everything seems okay. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    One of the best spells of setting a world-class batter up you‚Äôll ever see from Scott Boland. Kept getting Virat Kohli to second-guess himself in terms of what to play at and what to leave alone with subtle changes in angle and length. Earned himself that big wicket #WTC2023Final‚Äî Bharat Sundaresan (@beastieboy07) June 11, 2023



    Scott Boland, W0W for real. What an over!#WTC23‚Äî Prajakta (@18prajakta) June 11, 2023



    Uff! What a catch from Steve Smith!‚Äî Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 11, 2023



    Boland doing what he does best. Striking regularly in an over. Aussies well on top now!  #WTC2023Final #AUSvsIND‚Äî Lisa Sthalekar (@sthalekar93) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 179/5 (47 overs): What an over from Scott Boland though. Decisive. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  46.5: Ravindra Jadeja 0(2) ct Alex Carey b Scott Boland, One brings two! Jadeja is out for a duck and Australia are back in the game in a matter of two balls. India 179/5 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    WICKET!  46.3: Virat Kohli 49(78) ct Steven Smith b Scott Boland, It was the classic grind from Kohli up until now. Australia, particularly Labushcg thought there was something in previous delivery too. A lapse in concentration and Kohli edges one to the slip in the next ball itself. India 179/4 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 179/3 (46 overs): Three runs off Cummins‚Äôs over. Kohli nearing his half-century.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 176/3 (45 overs): Australia are keeping things tight so far but Rahane and Kohli have been steady so far. Just one run off the over against Boland. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Can INDIA win? Well, yes‚Ä¶ Can Australia win? Surely, yes‚Ä¶But seeing a Test match goes into Day 5 with everything on the line is heartening! #WTC2023Final #AUSvIND‚Äî Naveen Peter (@peterspeaking) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 175/3 (44 overs): The ball hits Rahane‚Äôs helmet and bounces to the boundary for four. Six runs off the over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 169/3 (43 overs): Boland appeals for LBW and it struck between middle and leg but Australia don‚Äôt review. Just one run off the over. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 168/3 (42 overs): The running between the wickets will always be a highlight with Kohli in the middle and he runs hard for his first run of the day. Four runs off the over.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    How flat is this pitch? One ball can change the game, just as surely as Kohli can find enough support to tantalize us.  Hope Lyon goes over the wicket to the right handlers at some point to better attack both edges. Worth watching, and listeningüëè‚Äî jim maxwell (@jimmaxcricket) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India second innings, 164/3 (41 overs): A maiden over to start with for Australia.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Scott Boland to start the proceedings for Australia.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Hello and welcome to our coverage of ICC World Test Championship Final, Day 5. India finished at 164/3 at stumps on Day 4, still needing a further 280 runs to reach what would be a record-breaking total of 444 on the fifth and final day.Australia, by contrast, require just seven more wickets Sunday to win the only major global men‚Äôs trophy to have so far eluded them and ensure they head into next week‚Äôs Ashes opener against England at Edgbaston in buoyant mood.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    It‚Äôs coming down to the wire! Our Aussie men lead by 280 runs and need seven wickets to win with one day to play. üá¶üá∫ #WTCFinal pic.twitter.com/07YH9Sc1VQ‚Äî Cricket Australia (@CricketAus) June 10, 2023



    It all boils down to this! The final day of the World Test Championship Final. Let's do this #TeamIndia üí™üèæ #WTC23 pic.twitter.com/i91euseQ4v‚Äî BCCI (@BCCI) June 11, 2023



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    India pacer Mohammed Shami, said after the end of play on Day 4: ‚ÄúA hundred percent everyone believes that tomorrow we will win the match, because we have always fought. We perform well around the¬†world... It doesn‚Äôt matter if it‚Äôs Sydney or Brisbane, we are playing here.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Playing XIsAustralia XI: David Warner, Usman Khawaja, Marnus Labuschagne, Steve Smith, Travis Head, Cameron Green, Alex Carey (wk), Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins (c), Nathan Lyon, Scott BolandIndia XI: Rohit Sharma (c), Shubman Gill, Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli, Ajinkya Rahane, KS Bharat (wk), Ravindra Jadeja, Shardul Thakur, Umesh Yadav, Mohammed Shami, Mohammed Siraj
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Screenshots in the blog courtesy: Disney+Hotstar / ICCWith text inputs from AFP and ICC Business Corporation FZ LLC 2020 via Online Media Zone

tags: ICC World Test Championship Test Final
